createToken.title: @:createTokenText

disclaimer: {disclaimerPrefix} This website is maintained by the {Sora} community. Before continuing to use this website, please review the {polkaswapFaqLink} and documentation, which includes a detailed explanation on how {AppName} works, as well as the {memorandumLink}, and {privacyLink}. These documents are crucial to a secure and positive user experience. By using {AppName}, you acknowledge that you have read and understand these documents. You also acknowledge the following: 1) your sole responsibility for compliance with all laws that may apply to your particular use of {AppName} in your legal jurisdiction; 2) your understanding that the current version of {AppName} is an alpha version: it has not been fully tested, and some functions may not perform as designed; and 3) your understanding and voluntary acceptance of the risks involved in using {AppName}, including, but not limited to, the risk of losing tokens. Please do not continue without reading the {polkaswapFaqLink}, {memorandumLink}, {privacyLink}!
networkFeeTooltipText: Network fee is used to ensure {Sora} system's growth and stable performance.
ethNetworkFeeTooltipText: Please note that the {network} network fees displayed on {AppName} are only rough estimations, you can see the correct fee amount in your connected {network} wallet prior to confirming the transaction.

network.title: What is {Sora}?
network.description: {AppName} is built on top of the {Sora} Network, and the {Sora} token (XOR) is used for gas/fees and liquidity provision on {AppName}. {Sora} Network allows for reduced fees, faster transactions and simpler consensus finalization and is focused on delivering interoperability across other blockchain ecosystems like {Ethereum}.

polkadot.title: What is {PolkadotJs}?
polkadot.description: {PolkadotJs} extension is a browser extension available for Firefox and Chrome dedicated to managing accounts for Substrate-based chains, including {Sora}, {Polkadot} and {Kusama}. You can add, import, and export accounts and sign transactions or extrinsics that you have initiated from websites you have authorized.

dexSettings.title: Settings

marketAlgorithmTooltip.main: - option to choose between Primary Market (TBC), Secondary Market (XYK) or a combined smart algorithm for guaranteed best price for any given transaction.

dexSettings.slippageToleranceHint: Your transaction will revert if the price changes unfavorably by more than this percentage.
dexSettings.transactionDeadlineHint: Transaction will be cancelled if it is pending for more than this long.

marketAlgorithms.SMART: {smartAlgorithm} liquidity routing ensures the best price for any transaction by combining only the best price options from all available markets. When available, Token Bonding Curve ({tbcAlgorithm}) will be used for liquidity as long as the asset price is more affordable than from other sources, upon which the {xycAlgorithm} pool is utilized.
marketAlgorithms.TBC: {tbcAlgorithm} ‚Äî buying only from the Token Bonding Curve (Primary Market). There is a possibility that the price can become unfavorable compared to the {xycAlgorithm} pool (Secondary Market), but the value received from the vested rewards might turn out to be much more favorable over time.
marketAlgorithms.XYK: {xycAlgorithm} ‚Äî buying only from the XYK Pool (Secondary Market). Traditional XYK pool swap.

Normally only the supported tokens should be available for purchase via MoonPay in {AppName}, hence something must have gone wrong somewhere. Please don‚Äôt hesitate to let the community know about this case in the {AppName} Telegram group.

browserNotificationDialog.title: Set Notifications
browserNotificationDialog.info: We will send you only relevant updates about your wallet, for example: asset balance changes

browserNotificationDialog.rotateMessage: The experience is only available in portrait mode

welcome.headline: Let‚Äôs set up your account
welcome.text: Create your {Sora} Network account or log into the old ones using mnemonic phrase or .json import. This allows you to securely sign transactions and manage assets in {Sora} Network.

accountName.desc: This is the name of your account. It will be visible only to you in {Polkaswap}.

password.desc: Ensure you are using a strong unique password for proper protection (8 characters minimum)

desktop.seedAdviceText: The 12-word passphrase is a private key to regain access to your {Sora} account in case you lose access to your {wallet} account. Store it safely in the exact order it appears above.
desktop.confirmSeedText: Confirm the passphrase by clicking the words in the correct order
desktop.exportJsonText: You will always be able to restore your account by importing this {JSON} file. Do not share it with anyone! Store it safely, preferably encrypted.

dialog.savePasswordText: Remember my password for next 15 minutes
dialog.extendPasswordText: Extend period without password by 15 minutes

errorMessages.jsonFields: JSON file does not have required fields

desktop.deleteAccountText: Account can‚Äôt be recovered without a seed phrase, .json file or if it‚Äôs stored in some extension. You will be logged out.

importSteps.selectWallet: Open the wallet with your existing account(s)
importSteps.selectAccount: Select the account you want to export

desktop.seedAdviceAdditionTitle: Never share your passphrase with anyone!
desktop.seedAdviceAdditionText: If someone asks you for your passphrase they are most likely trying to scam you and steal your assets!

tooltips.roi: {ROI} stands for Return on Investment. It is calculated by dividing the profit earned on an investment by the cost of that investment in a percentage equivalent.
tooltips.tvl: {TVL} stands for Total Value Locked. It represents tokens locked in the pools in the dollar equivalent.
tooltips.volume: Volume refers to the total amount of assets that have been traded or exchanged on the network over a specific period of time. The volume is an important metric for measuring the liquidity and overall activity of the network.
tooltips.fees: Fees on the {Sora} blockchain refer to the charges that are incurred for executing transactions on the network. These fees are paid in XOR, the native cryptocurrency of the {Sora} Network. The fee amount is determined by the complexity and size of the transaction being executed
tooltips.supply: Token supply refers to the total number of tokens that have been created and are in circulation on the network. The token supply can fluctuate based on the amount of tokens being staked, burned, or transferred on the network.
tooltips.transactions: Transactions refer to the process of sending or receiving digital assets on the network, including liquidity operations, as well as swaps.
tooltips.accounts: Accounts are digital addresses that hold user's assets on the network. Each account is associated with a unique public address and a private key that allows the user to access and manage their assets.
tooltips.bridgeTransactions: {from} to {to} bridge refers to the process of transferring assets between the {from} and {to} networks using a bridge. The bridge allows for the interoperability of the two networks, enabling users to seamlessly move assets between them.
tooltips.velocity: Token velocity is the number of times token changes accounts during period (month) on average. It indicates the level of trading activity and liquidity.

internet.label: Your internet speed
internet.dialogDesc: {Polkaswap} requires internet connection for stable experience

alerts.alertsTooltip: Price alerts are notifications that can be set by you to receive updates when the price of a particular token reaches certain point you set
alerts.frequencyTooltip: Select between 'once' and 'always' to determine how often you receive notifications for the chosen alert type. 'Once' will send a single notification when the condition is met, while 'always' will continue to notify you each time the price threshold is crossed
alerts.noSupportMsg: Notifications aren't supported by your browser
alerts.typeTooltip: Choose either 'drops below' or 'rises above' option to specify alert condition for tracking important price movements. These options allow you receive timely notifications when the value of your asset either falls below or rises above your designated threshold

fiatDisclaimer: Please note that the fiat values associated with cryptocurrencies on our website are provided by external services (Subquery, Subsquid, Ceres API)  are approximate. Given the inherent complexity of these calculations, absolute precision at all times cannot be guaranteed.

fiatPayment.moonpayDesc: Purchase ETH tokens on {Ethereum} and transfer them to {SORA} network via the bridge
fiatPayment.errorMessage: Apologies for the inconvenience. We're working diligently to resolve this. Please, try again later.
fiatPayment.cedeStoreDesc: Transfer any tokens from {value1} to {value2} via {value3}

addressBook.searchPlaceholder: Search by address, name or identity
addressBook.noContacts: You don‚Äôt have any contacts added yet
addressBook.tooltip: Collect address book by providing name and address to keep your contacts organized and up-to-date
addressBook.notSoraAddress: This address will be saved as {SORA} address below. Make sure the recipient can access the {SORA} chain:

browserPermission.title: Allow camera access in browser settings
browserPermission.desc: To ensure the authenticity of documents and validate user identity for KYC verification, access to your device's camera is required.
browserPermission.disclaimer: Camera access is required for real-time document capture to prevent fraud.

overview.title: {Sora} Staking
overview.description: Stake {XOR} tokens on {Sora} Network as a nominator to validate transactions and earn {VAL} token rewards.

newStake.title: Start staking
newStake.minStakeWarning: The minimum stake to receive the reward is {min} {symbol}

validatorsList.name: Name
validatorsList.noNominatedValidators: You don't have any nominated validators
validatorsList.noValidators: There are no validators satisfying the specified filter
validatorsList.commissionTooltip: Commission refers to the fee charged by validators for their services in the staking process. This fee, expressed as a percentage, is deducted from the staking rewards earned by nominators before distribution. It's important to note that validators can adjust their commission rates at any time

hasIdentity.name: On-chain identity
hasIdentity.description: At least one identity contact connected to the account

notSlashed.name: Not slashed
notSlashed.description: Not experienced any penalties or reductions in their staked funds due to misconduct or protocol violations.

notOversubscribed.name: Not oversubscribed
notOversubscribed.description: Account within allocation limit, avoids oversubscription penalties on {Polkadot} staking.

twoValidatorsPerIdentity.name: Limit of 2 validators per identity
twoValidatorsPerIdentity.description: A maximum of two validators per identity to promote decentralization and prevent concentration of power.

validatorsAttentionDialog.title: Attention
description: Algorithmic validator suggestions do not constitute financial consultation or advice. Staking is a high-risk activity, and algorithmic validator suggestions do not necessarily mitigate this risk.

A validator suggested by the algorithm could still be slashed. A validator suggested by the algorithm could also change their parameters (e.g.,commission rates, etc.) at any time after having been suggested and/or selected.

You could lose tokens or rewards for these or other reasons. Only stake tokens and use validator suggestions at your own discretion, after conducting due diligence and carefully considering the risks involved.

pendingRewardsDialog.information: Validators payout the rewards every 2-5 days. However, you can payout them by yourself, especially if rewards are close to expiring, but you will pay the fee.
pendingRewardsDialog.title: Pending rewards

selectValidatorsMode.title: Stake with validators suggested by the algorithm
selectValidatorsMode.description: {Sora} network algorithm has selected a list of recommended validators based on the criteria:

claimRewardsDialog.title: Claim rewards
claimRewardsDialog.checkRewards: Check rewards per era and validator

allWithdrawsDialog.title: Unstaking activity
allWithdrawsDialog.information: Once you unstake tokens, there is a mandatory 7-day unstaking period. After this period, your tokens will not be automatically returned to your wallet. You must complete the process by manually withdrawing your tokens.

history.connect: Connect an account to start trading

orderTable.noOrders: No orders. Create your first one!

dialog.askCancel: Are you sure you want to cancel all of your open orders?

tooltip.limitOrder: A 'Limit' order lets you specify the exact price at which you want to buy or sell an asset. A 'Limit Buy' order will only be executed at the specified price or lower, while a 'Limit Sell' order will execute only at the specified price or higher. This control ensures you don't pay more or sell for less than you're comfortable with.
tooltip.marketOrder: A 'Market Order' is an order to immediately buy or sell at the best available current price. It doesn't require setting a price, ensuring a fast execution but with the trade-off of less control over the price received or paid. This type of order is used when certainty of execution is a priority over price control.
tooltip.pairsList: A real-time list showing current buy and sell orders for a cryptocurrency. It helps you understand the demand, potential price direction, and trade volume on the SORA Network and Polkaswap DEX
tooltip.bookWidget: A live, constantly updating record of buy (bid) and sell (ask) orders for a specific asset, organized by price level. The order book displays the depth of the market, including the quantities of assets being offered at various prices. Traders utilize this detailed view to gauge market sentiment, identify potential resistance and support levels, and anticipate price movements based on existing demand and supply
tooltip.marketWidget: This widget shows a real-time stream of executed trades in the market, providing information on transaction volumes, recent activity, and current market trends. By observing the timing, price, and size of actual trades, traders can gain insights into market dynamics and sentiment, helping them to spot trading opportunities and make informed decisions

txDetails.orderType: 'Buy' order will only be executed at the specified price or lower, while a 'Sell' order will execute only at the specified price or higher. This control ensures you don't pay more or sell for less than you're comfortable with.
txDetails.expiryDate: The 'Expiry Date' is the deadline for your order to be executed. If the market doesn't reach your specified price before this date, the order is automatically cancelled. You're not bound to a perpetual wait if market conditions don't align with your trading preferences.
txDetails.amount: The 'Amount' refers to the total number of assets you want to buy or sell in your order. It's important to specify, as it determines the size of your transaction, impacting the total cost for buy orders or revenue for sell orders.
txDetails.limit: The 'Limit Price' is the precise price you set for a limit order. The trade will only execute when the asset's market price meets your limit price, ensuring you don't purchase above or sell below this specified value.
txDetails.locked: The 'Locked' shows the amount of asset to be held while order is ongoing.

bookStatus.active: Full trading functionality enabled. You can place new orders or cancel existing ones.
bookStatus.placeable: Limited functionality. You can place new orders and cancel existing ones, but some features may be unavailable.
bookStatus.cancelable: You can only cancel existing orders. New order placement is currently disabled.
bookStatus.inactive: All trading activities are currently halted. No orders can be placed or canceled at this time.

beyondPrecision.reason: Entered price is too precise to calculate
beyondPrecision.reading: Precision exceeded: The amount/price entered has too many decimal places. Please input a value with fewer decimal places

marketNotAvailable.reason: Not enough orders available to fullfill this order
marketNotAvailable.reading: Market order limitation: There are not enough orders available to fulfill this market order. Please adjust your order size or wait for more orders to be placed

exceedsSpread.reading: Price exceeded: a market's bid or ask price exceeded its ask/bid price

spotLimit.reading: Price range cap: Each order book side is limited to 1024 unique price points. Please select a price within the existing range or wait for space to become available

accountLimit.reading: Limit reached: Each account is confined to 1024 limit orders. Please wait until some of your orders fulfill

singlePriceLimit.reason: Too many orders is ongoing for this price
singlePriceLimit.reading: Limit reached: Each position is confined to 1024 limit orders. Please wait until some orders fulfill

outOfBounds.reading: Blockchain range exceeded: Your entered amount falls outside the blockchain's allowed range. Min: {min}; Max: {max}
outOfBounds.reason: Amount fails to comply with blockchain range

multipleOf.reading: To process your order, please input a price that is a multiple of {value}

kensetsu.addCollateralDescription: Deposit more assets into your position to increase your borrowing limit or to improve your loan-to-value ratio. This can also help prevent liquidation.
kensetsu.totalCollateralDescription: The total value of all assets currently deposited in your position. This value affects your borrowing capacity and risk of liquidation.
kensetsu.debtAvailableDescription: The amount of funds you can still draw from your position without exceeding your borrowing limit, based on your current collateral.
kensetsu.ltvDescription: The ratio of the amount drawn to the value of the collateral in your position, expressed as a percentage. A higher {LTV} increases potential returns but also risk, including the chance of liquidation.
kensetsu.borrowMoreDescription: Draw additional funds from your position up to the maximum available amount. Ensure your collateral value supports the increased debt to avoid liquidation risks.
kensetsu.outstandingDebtDescription: The total amount you currently owe from the funds drawn from your position, including accrued interest. This needs to be repaid to close your position or maintain healthy loan-to-value ratios.
kensetsu.createVaultDescription: Initiate a new transaction by depositing collateral into your position and drawing funds. This creates a debt obligation that you must manage.
kensetsu.minDepositCollateralDescription: The minimum amount of assets required to open a position. This initial deposit secures the funds you wish to borrow.
kensetsu.maxAvailableToBorrowDescription: The maximum amount you can draw from your position, determined by the value of your collateral. This limit adjusts as the value of the collateral changes.
kensetsu.borrowTaxDescription: The {value} tax applied to the borrowed amount
kensetsu.repayDebtDescription: Return borrowed funds to reduce your outstanding debt. This can decrease interest costs and lower the risk of liquidation.
kensetsu.closeVaultDescription: Close the selected position by repaying all outstanding debt and withdrawing all collateral
kensetsu.yourCollateralDescription: The assets you've deposited into your position to secure the funds drawn. These assets may be liquidated by the lender if you fail to maintain the required loan-to-value ratio.
kensetsu.yourDebtDescription: The total amount currently outstanding in your position, including the drawn amount and any accrued interest. This balance increases over time if interest accumulates.
kensetsu.requiredAmountWithSlippageDescription: For a smooth position closure, buy slightly more {tokenSymbol} than the {amount} required due to possible slippage. You need an extra to cover the shortfall. Swap your assets into {tokenSymbol} to meet this need.
kensetsu.introDescription: Experience safe and effortless borrowing and lending. Open borrowing positions with {Kensetsu} platform.
kensetsu.disclaimerDescription: Borrowing digital assets through {Polkaswap} carries significant risk and is entirely at your own risk. The value of digital assets is highly volatile, and any changes in the market prices of the assets you have borrowed or used as collateral can lead to substantial financial losses.
kensetsu.availableToBorrowDescription: The remaining amount you are eligible to draw under the current conditions of your position, based on your deposited collateral and any existing debt.
kensetsu.liquidationPenaltyDescription: A fee applied if the value of your collateral falls below a certain threshold, prompting the sale of assets to cover the debt. This penalty increases your total debt.
kensetsu.interestDescription: An annual fee charged on the amount drawn from your position, calculated as a percentage. This fee compensates for risks and market fluctuations.
kensetsu.totalCollateralReturnedDescription: The total value of assets returned to you after closing your position, including total remaining collateral.
kensetsu.overallTotalCollateralDescription: The total value of assets deposited by borrowers to secure their borrowing positions on the {Kensetsu} platform.
kensetsu.overallTotalDebtDescription: The total amount of debt currently outstanding across all borrowing positions on the {Kensetsu} platform.
kensetsu.overallBadDebtDescription: The portion of debt that is unlikely to be recovered due to borrower default or insufficient collateral.
kensetsu.ltvMaxTooltip: The maximum amount of a borrowing position that can be provided in relation to the appraised value of the asset being used as collateral.
kensetsu.overallAvailableDescription: The total amount of funds available for borrowing on the {Kensetsu} platform.

accountSettings.title: Account settings
accountSettings.hint: You can enable this back in account settings

confirmation.title: Disable transaction confirmation
confirmation.description: A popup screen which displays details about the transactions before the signing.

signature.title: Disable password confirmation
signature.description: Enable or disable the need to enter your password during the signature popup in transactions.

currencyDialog.searchPlaceholder: Search by currency name or symbol

browserNotificationLocalStorageOverride.title: Clear local {AppName} storage
browserNotificationLocalStorageOverride.info: Your local storage is overloaded, to continue work with {AppName} need to clean it

points.title: Your Points
points.loginText: Connect your account to see your points
